question: During your round,Julie hits their ball onto the practice chipping area. What should they do?*

choices.text: Play the ball as it lies in the practice area without penalty.
Retrieve the ball and drop it near where it crossed into the practice area, with a one-stroke penalty.
Consider the ball out of bounds and play a provisional ball from the original spot, with a stroke penalty.
Treat the practice area as a wrong green and take free relief by dropping within one club-length of the nearest point of relief, no closer to the hole.

explanation: If you hit your your ball into a practice chipping green you get free relief in the same way you would get f it landed on the wrong green. Find the nearest point of relief no closer to the hole and take a drop within 1 club length
